{"cells":[{"type":"documentation","id":1,"json":{"ops":[{"insert":"Introduction"},{"attributes":{"header":2},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"EngineeringPaper is a tool that evaluates complex mathematical expressions while keeping track of the units for you. EngineeringPaper also has the capability to solve systems of equations. Once you have your calculation the way you want it, you can easily save or share you sheet with others by creating a shareable link. This sheet introduces you to the basics of using EngineeringPaper.

Cell Types"},{"attributes":{"header":2},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"An EngineeringPaper sheet consists of documentation cells and math cells. This cell is a documentation cell and the three cells after this cell are math cells. There are two primary math statement types that appear in math cells, an assignment statement and a query statement. For an assignment statement, a parameter name is provided on the left hand side and an expression is provided on the right hand side. Here are some examples of assignment statements:
"}]}},{"type":"math","id":0,"latex":"l=10\left[m\right]"},{"type":"math","id":2,"latex":"w=3\left[m\right]"},{"type":"math","id":3,"latex":"area\ =\ l\cdot w"},{"type":"documentation","id":4,"json":{"ops":[{"insert":"Specifying Units"},{"attributes":{"header":2},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"Anytime a numerical values appear in an expression, units may be provided in square brackets immediately after the numerical value. If no units are provided, numerical values are treated as unitless. EngineeringPaper will keep track of the units throughout all of the calculations and will generate an error if units are not consistent. 

Querying Results"},{"attributes":{"header":2},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"A query statement is used to obtain the result of a calculation. A query statement consists of a expression on the left hand side and the right hand side is left blank. When a query statement is encountered, EngineeringPaper knows that the results of a calculation are desired and it will automatically fill in the right hand side. Here are some examples of query statements:
"}]}},{"type":"math","id":5,"latex":"area="},{"type":"math","id":6,"latex":"\frac{10\ \left[miles\right]}{1\ \left[hour\right]}="},{"type":"documentation","id":8,"json":{"ops":[{"insert":"Specifying Result Units"},{"attributes":{"header":2},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"Note that the result units default to SI base units. To display results in different units, the desired output units my be specified in square brackets on the right hand side of a query statement. This capability is demonstrated in the following example:
"}]}},{"type":"math","id":9,"latex":"\frac{10\ \left[miles\right]}{1\left[hour\right]}=\left[\frac{miles}{day}\right]"},{"type":"documentation","id":10,"json":{"ops":[{"insert":"Automatic Calculation Ordering"},{"attributes":{"header":2},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"EngineeringPaper will automatically perform calculations in the correct order independent of the order of the math cells appear in the sheet. See the following example:
"}]}},{"type":"math","id":13,"latex":"volume="},{"type":"math","id":11,"latex":"volume=area\cdot h"},{"type":"math","id":12,"latex":"h=3\left[m\right]"},{"type":"documentation","id":14,"json":{"ops":[{"insert":"Automatic Cell Updates"},{"attributes":{"header":2},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"All edits update the impacted cells immediately. Change the value of "},{"attributes":{"italic":true},"insert":"h"},{"insert":" in the above cell to see the "},{"attributes":{"italic":true},"insert":"volume"},{"insert":" update as soon as the edit is made.

Saving and Sharing Sheets"},{"attributes":{"header":2},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"If you would like to save a sheet for future use or share a sheet with someone else, use the Get Shareable Link button "},{"insert":{"image":"data:image/png;base64,"}},{"insert":" on the top toolbar to create a shareable link. The link is private unless you choose to share it with someone else. Anytime you would like to save changes to a sheet, it is necessary to generate a new shareable link since sheets are not automatically saved. To start a new sheet, use the New Sheet button "},{"insert":{"image":"data:image/png;base64,"}},{"insert":" on the top toolbar.

Solving Equations"},{"attributes":{"header":2},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"In addition to evaluating statements, engineering paper can solve equations (including systems of equations). The third type of math statement is an equality statement where expressions appear on both both sides of the equals sign. EngineeringPaper won't do anything with an equality statement by itself but will use equality statements to evaluate query statements that share the same parameters as the equality statements. EngineeringPaper currently doesn't support numerically solving systems of equations so a solution will only be found if an exact solution exists. See the following example of solving a quadratic equation:
"}]}},{"type":"math","id":15,"latex":"a\cdot x^{2}+b\cdot x+c=0"},{"type":"math","id":16,"latex":"x="},{"type":"documentation","id":18,"json":{"ops":[{"insert":"Notice that both solutions to the quadratic equation are provided in the query statement. When using the equation solving capability of EngineeringPaper, the entire sheet is treated as a system of equations so it's generally best to only solve one system of equations per sheet to avoid conflicts between parameters.
"}]}}],"title":"Introduction to EngineeringPaper","results":[null,{"value":"","units":""},{"value":"","units":""},{"value":"","units":""},null,{"value":"30.0","numeric":true,"units":"m^2","unitsLatex":"\left[ m^2\right] ","real":true,"finite":true},{"value":"4.4704","numeric":true,"units":"m^1*sec^-1","unitsLatex":"\left[ \frac{m}{sec}\right] ","real":true,"finite":true},null,{"value":"4.4704","numeric":true,"units":"m^1*sec^-1","unitsLatex":"\left[ \frac{m}{sec}\right] ","real":true,"finite":true,"userUnitsValueDefined":true,"userUnitsValue":240,"unitsMismatch":false},null,{"value":"90.0","numeric":true,"units":"m^3","unitsLatex":"\left[ m^3\right] ","real":true,"finite":true},{"value":"","units":""},{"value":"","units":""},null,{"value":"","units":""},{"value":"- \frac{0.5 b}{a} - \frac{1.0 \left(- a c + 0.25 b^{2}\right)^{0.5}}{a},\ - \frac{0.5 b}{a} + \frac{1.0 \left(- a c + 0.25 b^{2}\right)^{0.5}}{a}","numeric":false,"units":"","unitsLatex":"","real":false}],"nextId":19,"sheetId":"{"0":871400563,"1":1308214681,"2":4184099603,"3":3161919630,"4":95438632,"5":4280592348,"6":3383470854,"7":3558699974,"8":557484763,"9":972620657}"}
